attributes.action: Hold a referendum in England on Repealing the 1707 Act of Union with Scotland
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Since devolution, Scottish MPs have been able to vote on matters in Westminster which do not affect their constituents-the so called Midlothian question-and this is unfair. English tax payers have largely funded a £30 billion block grant to scotland for their schools, roads, care homes and for cancer drugs not available in england. Scotland also receives £1500 more per head than england in funding. The £2 billion required by the SNP to fund free university education in scotland will be largely paid for by english tax payers. This all has to stop. The SNP wants independance so lets have a referendum in england to end the Union with Scotland, give it its independance and spend english tax payers' money to help them.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
